Description: Upper section of a glazed steatite shabti of Pediamenope with a lappet-wig, a carved face and ears, crossed hands in relief holding the two relief hoes, the waist section is inscribed with Chapter 6 of The Book of The Dead in one row(surviving) of incised hieroglyphs, the back of one arm is decorated with an incised representation of a seed-basket.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
